column1: 1$Condition: Anxiousness associated with Depression$12/2/2019 9:03:25 PM$Reviewer: MyLife
column2: 25-34 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$2$5$On and off
column3: Mostly on for 3 or so years. 1stly
column4: effects were noticed by others before noticed by myself. Weight loss due to loss of appetite and then mild weight gain once I started feeling a little more care free. This 'drug' definitely helped with my anxiety. It made me overall very positive. Not 100% better but way more bearable. Helped with getting angry. All was great until I started to continuously notice this lack of empathy
column5: cloudiness In what felt like my frontal lobe
column6: my sex drive severely dropped
column7: and then this major suicidal depression came like a freight train for some reason. Honestly It bummed me out but I knew getting off it was for the better. Now that I have been off of it for a few months
column8: I like the natural feeling better. I think. My anxiety is back but I feel like I can deal with it better. My thoughts come easier. My memory is better.. It feels more 'real.'  However I still have a depressing cloud that lingers over me But SO much better then what was happening to me towards the end. I miss not getting angry so easy and the ease of having positive thoughts. However Im hoping that this experience has helped me learn how to balance things on my own without the help of a prescription. Overall it 'worked great
column9: ' My dosage might have needed to be changed. It could be the stressful but Im confident that being off medication is more the type of life I wanna live.

column1: 15$Condition: Posttraumatic Stress Syndrome$7/28/2018 4:10:34 PM$Reviewer: 55-64 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$5$3$I am somewhat happy with the medication Citalopram HBR 20MG which I have recently been increased to 30MGs. I used to work in corrections
column2: but now work as a security officer. However
column3: whilst working security March 15
column4: 2015 in an apartment complex
column5: I was lured into the parkade due to a fire alarm where 6 men were waiting for Me. I have since suffered from night terrors
column6: but refused to be a victim so I returned to work for 1 year
column7: then the depression
column8: anxiety
column9: and suicidal thoughts came. Workers comp had Me see a PTSD Psychologist right after the attack for 2 visits
column10: then had Me see him again. He diagnosed Me with delayed onset post traumatic stress
column11: however WCB will only look at the physical aspects of the attack
column12: not the psychological ones. I have now voluntarily been admitted to the psych ward due to wanting to end My life and the Psychiatrist here has put Me on Citalopram. The night terrors have not stopped at all
column13: but I've learned a new coping method by looking for something particular in the room (like My chair) as a grounding to let Me know that I am not at work and the attack is not real. Since taking the 30 Mg of Citalopram the thoughts of ending my life have ceased greatly. Iind myself a lot happier
column14: yet am tired more.

column1: For people just starting to take Celexa (or Citalopram)
column2: I suggest starting with no more than 10 mg in the morning. Don't take it at night! The side effects I experienced by starting off with 20 mg at night might not have been caused by the medication (according to my doctor)
column3: but I suggest that you take no chances: start in the morning with or after breakfast. Keep in mind that there is a light at the end of the tunnel

484$Condition: Depression$8/23/2011 4:41:40 PM$Reviewer: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $3$3$4$I have been taking Citalopram for over a year now.My doctor had switched me because for about 10 years I had been taking Fluoxetine (Prozac) and didn't feel it was effective anymore.One bad side effect of this medication has to do with sex.Males might want to take note.You can achieve an erection and have sex for very long periods of time.BUT you might not climax all the time or very rarely.This occured with my girlfriend and myself.I saw my doctor yesterday and he said it was definately the Citalopram causing me not to climax.He also told me that this drug is also used for men who have pre mature ejaculation problems.So that solved my mystery. column3: not depression. Worked well for that and social anxiety. This drug is a definite killer of one's sex life. After 12 years or so of taking
column4: I decided to try and get off this drug. My 1st attempt was a disaster thanks to my doctor at the time telling me ""just quit taking""
column5: not gradually decrease. Never
column6: ever try it this way. I have since then been fired him. My main advice for those attempting withdrawal is to do so in a gradual
column7: well-managed way. Keep a record as to when you start
column8: how you feel day by day
column9: any unusual occurrences. I started with a 1/2 tab decrease for a week
column10: then 1/4 for another week
column11: and finally 1/4 every other day for the final week. I still can hardly believe I am free of this drug
column12: but I am and my life is much better for it. The key is to slowly step it down. "

column1: 999$Condition: Other$9/13/2009 10:19:28 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$1$5$Doctor prescribed after going to the hospital 3 times for chest tightness and pain in the sternum area...after ruling out all serious conditions the only thing they could find was a Hiatel hernia with acid refux which I constantly worried about so he started me on Xanax .5mg 4 times a day and 20mg of citalopram once a day. I stopped worrying but did have side effects once I stopped the xanax that included dry mouth
column2: heavy sweating in arm pits
column3: blurred vision in left eye
column4: tingle sensations in hands and feet
column5: pounding heart beat which would pulse in head as I slept at night
column6: dizziness
column7: lightheaded
column8: and decreased sexual sensation. (could climax just take longer..too long) also felt tired throughout the day even after stopping the xanax so I switched to taking at night which helped. side effects improved or I got used to them and continued taking for 5 months but never really felt like I needed it as I was still having my original problem and once convinced it was not something serious I felt like I could handle things without drugs so I tapered off too 10mg for two weeks then stopped. (doctor wanted me to stay on it until December) On about day 4 of stopping I started feeling severe lightheadedness almost feel kinda drunk and it has not stopped yet (7th day) I have considered taking xanax again until this stops but have not yet (been toughing it out) very scaring feeling wish I never took this drug and just want to feel normal again. I would rather have worry and pain than this. seeing a surgeon next week to hopefully fix hernia and put all my worries behind.

column1: Some family members sat me down and told me they were very concerned that stress and depression were ruining my health and for what might happen to me...

A-D's are serious drugs and can have serious side effects

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$5$"THis is an Update to an earlier post:

column5: helped me stop yelling and helped me be more calm. I don't experience the Road Rage and am able to be more in control. Once I feel that my situation is changing or better than it was before. I will consult my doctor on how to get myself off of this
column6: as I don't want it to become  a perminanat crutch for my mental health.

column1: I did find that the medication made me far less moody and less agitated by ""the little things.""  I am a self-diagnosed obsessive-compulsive and I find it difficult to concentrate in disorganized environments or a room that is in disarray.

1225$Condition: Panic Disorder$1/23/2009 5:15:56 PM$Reviewer: tskittin, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$5$Had no effect on my anxiety and in fact my PTSD symptoms started coming back. Even with my Ambien I have experienced sleep problems. I experienced most all the side effects and have been extremely sick since first I started this medication and my illnesses got worse.  Have been in ER a couple of times with all the symptoms this medicaiton has, but, since I didnt really read the serious side effects I had no clue I personally should not take this medication with other medications I have. A friend suggested today I look at not only serious side effects but drug interactions and after2 1/2 months of ER doctors running all kinds of tests and coming up negative and my doctor treating me for bronchitis but not paying attention to my other complaints I have had the following serious drug interactions as noted under the tab of interactions with other drugs Tell your doctor immediately if any of these rare but very serious side effects occur: stomach pain, fainting, bloody/black/tarry stools, vomit that looks like coffee grounds, easy bruising/bleeding, muscle weakness/cramps, seizures, fast/irregular/pounding heartbeat, difficulty urinating, change in the amount of urine.  I have fainted once in my life years ago...but 2 weeks ago when she increased my dosage a few nights later I fainted...I thought for no reason at all!  I take Lorazepam and Ambien for over 5 years and evidently this drug does NOT interact well for me.  I also have had Vicodin due to the pain from the coughing from the bronchitis along with OTC cough syrups and Theraflu type medications. I HIGHLY suggest you pay much attention to side effects and drug interractions PRIOR to agreeing to take this antidepressant!

column1: 1633$Condition: Depression$4/19/2016 12:44:22 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year$5$4$5$I began treatment nine months ago because I was stressed out beyond belief. I work full time and take 6-9 credit hours/semester while raising two children. Surprisingly I was diagnosed with depression. I started with 10 mg of Celexa. My mood improved tremendously within the first two weeks. I had zero side effects. I don't feel numb to emotion
column2: in fact I feel like I have better control over my emotions. Everyday stresses bothered me less. Overall I am very pleased with this drug. The only downside for me is that it does not interact well with alcohol. I like to drink socially and can usually hold my liquor very well but
column3: since being on this drug
column4: I blackout easily which never happened to me before. I have be very careful not to overdo it.

column1: 1636$Condition: Anxiousness associated with Depression$3/28/2016 1:26:04 PM$Reviewer: Logan
column2: 55-64 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I was experiencing long term problems with anxiety and depression that I finally realized required medical help. After discussing the problems I was dealing with
column3: my doctor prescribed 10mg of citalopram for me with instructions for a return consult in a couple weeks. I felt a little sedated at first but also much more at ease and less depressed. Wife quickly noticed the difference in my demeanor as well and now makes sure that I take the medication on schedule. I had some minor GI upset initially which dissipated. The only other problem with taking the drug was when my doctor increased the dose to 20mg
column4: which caused some sexual difficulties. After contacting my doctor
column5: I was instructed to reduce the dose back to 10mg a day or two before sex might be expected and then back to the 20mg dosage afterwards. I know
column6: this disrupts spontaneity but the overall tradeoff is well worth it for both me and my wife. We're both very happy with the results of the drug.

column1: 1637$Condition: Anxiousness associated with Depression$3/22/2016 4:32:41 PM$Reviewer: Gemma523
column2: 25-34 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$4$Before starting this medication I was very nervous about the potential side effects I read about online and other users negative reviews. I have now been on celexa (citalopram 20 mg) for a little over a month and I haven't experienced any negative side effects other than drowsiness after taking the medication. I take it before going to sleep at night so that it does not affect my daily routine. It wasn't until about the 4th week that I began to notice that my anxiety had decreased significantly. I used to become completely overcome with anxiety and worrying almost daily and I have now gone an entire week without becoming anxious at all. I do still experience anxious thoughts on occasion but I am now able to redirect my thinking and let them go rather than obsessively focusing on them and becoming depressed. I have never reviewed anything like this before but as there are so many bad reviews out there I thought it was important to let people know that my experience has been nothing but positive.

13-18 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$4$4$I started taking it almost a year ago for depression. After increasing dosage a few times when it started fading in effects
column3: I'm now on 30mg and will probably move up again in a few months. It's helped me have a good outlook and not be so depressed
column4: but therapy is also necessary for most people with underlying issues. There were some side effects like dry mouth and feeling numb inside for a little while but I'm satisfied now.

column1: 1640$Condition: Anxiousness associated with Depression$2/27/2016 11:09:11 PM$Reviewer: hj503
column2: 19-24 on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$"I've been taking Celexa for almost 6 months now and it has been a blessing for me. I take 40 mg every night right before bed and it has helped control my anxiety and depression. I have had anxiety and depression and have been medicated for as long as I can remember. Celexa has been the best medicine for me so far and I have been on plenty of other anxiety and depression medicines. I notice when something begins to upset me or stresses me out
column3: I become slightly dizzy and it feels a little like I'm having an out of body experience to the slightest degree. The feeling and dizziness fade quickly once I'm able to calm down. It's nothing horrible and it doesn't bother me much because the good effects from this medicine outweigh this side effect. I don't have the ""numb"" feeling that everybody talks about. I still feel happy
column4: sad
column5: and angry like I should. I'm just able to get through my days without the crippling effects of anxiety and depression. It was a little hard for me the first few weeks because I was convinced it wasn't working and I felt like my anxiety was actually increasing. But I stuck with it faithfully and at about 6 weeks
column6: I started to feel pretty good. I stopped having so many anxiety episodes during the day and I noticed I was a slightly bit more optimistic about life. I knew it was FINALLY starting to help and it has continually helped me more and more the longer I have stuck with it. I know Celexa isn't for everybody but it's been a literal life saver for me and I'm pleased with the mental progress I've been able to make since being on it. "

25-34 on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$3$4$"As for most
column3: my story is unique. I was prescribed Celexa due to Obsessive thinking
column4: social anxiety
column5: and mild depression. I have previously taken Prozac and Lexapro but wasn't too happy with them due to feeling detached and more of a ""zombie"". Celexa was the first medication I have ever taken that made me feel ""normal"" in that I didn't think my personality was being altered to any significant degree. I started at 20mg and gradually worked up to 30mg over the course of 4 months due to persistent social anxiety. Now
column6: roughly 6 months after starting Celexa
column7: I think it's time for ween myself off. One of the biggest issue I had was sexual dysfunction. I literally had no desire to have sex
column8: nor did it pop into my mind. I knew if someone was attractive and that I should be feeling some type of arousal
column9: but that never happened. Another HUGE issue for me is that whenever I get anxious I sweat ALOT. Some research and speaking to my MD helped me understand that SSRI's can affect ones temperature sensitivity. So i was getting anxious about sweating when the very thing that was supposed to make me not anxious caused me to sweat in the first place...go figure. I recently forgot to take Celexa for roughly 3 days and felt so much better (even though I knew withdrawal was bound to happen). Now i'm just taking 20mg a day and so far I am experiencing some confusion/detachment from reality."

column4: and obsessive-thinking

column6: but I think that this one is the right one for me. I still get anxiety
column7: it's just with this drug
column8: it is easier to manage. My head isn't always rushing like it used to be. I personally think it's a good drug.

column1: 1654$Condition: Panic Disorder$10/11/2015 9:35:22 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$"I am a 22 year old female
column2: and have been suffering from panic disorder and anticipatory anxiety for about 4 years. But due to a recent event that occurred about a month ago
column3: my panic disorder and anxiety had become CRIPPLING. I could not get through my days without either worrying about a panic attack to the point where I cause one
column4: or not even thinking about the panic attack and having it happen at any random time.It was getting to the point where I was living my days centered around trying to keep myself ""level
column5: but also petrified that I was going to have another attack. I had constant racing thoughts. My doctor recommended an SSRI for me-Celexa (Citalopram). He prescribed 20mg pills. I would take 10mg at night for the first four days
column6: and then after that I would take 20mg at night from then on. He also gave me a small  I MADE THE MISTAKE OF RESEARCHING ALL OF THE POSSIBLE SIDE EFFECTS!!!! I completely understand researching a drug before you take it- but it is important to remember that a lot of people who have positive experiences most often do not write about it. It is the people who have negative experiences who will. I was PETRIFIED to take the drug b/c of the horror stories
column7: until one day I realized that the side effects of the pill were worth it if it meant that I could have peaceful days. I took the first 10mg at night and had (and continue to have) a FANTASTIC sleep. I did not experience ANY nausea
column8: no tightness of chest
column9: no insomnia
column10: no panic
column11: no anxiety
column12: NOTHING but a slight headache. It felt as though the pill gave me relief almost immediately. I have been on the pills for a little over two weeks. They have been a lifesaver for me!! I feel at peace. The racing
column13: flooding thoughts have stopped. The panic attacks have been nonexistent. (My doctor gave me a prescription for Xanax just in case I have one) I feel like myself and I am happy again. I highly recommend trying them if you are suffering from anxiety
column14: panic disorder
column15: or depression."

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$2$5$"I took this medication for about 3 months to treat my anxiety and depression. The first two months I had a lot of nausea always about 1 hour after taking celexa
column3: however
column4: it worked amazing to relieve my anxiety and depression. For the first time in years
column5: I was able to relax and was happy. After the second month though
column6: I just began to feel numb. I didn't care about anything. Things that used to upset me no longer did
column7: but things that used to make me smile didn't affect me either. But my depression prior was severe
column8: so I stayed on it and focused on learning about myself and how unreasonable it is to feel unnecessary anxiety leading to depression. And things were better.

column1: The reason I stopped taking celexa is because it caused SEVERE MEMORY LOSS. It started small. I couldn't remember what happened yesterday. Then
column2: after month two
column3: I couldn't remember conversations people would tell me I had with them. And at the end of month three
column4: I was standing in front of a desk somewhere  (I don't even remember where I was) with a woman in front of me asking me what my name was. I stared blankly at her. I couldn't remember. I apologized and had to pull out my wallet and look at my drivers license to remember my middle name. I then began researching the drug and discovered that memory loss is a common side affect. I immediately stopped taking it
column5: but it still took me about 3 months for my memory to return to normal. But on a positive note
column6: it  feels back to normal now (about 1 year later) I apologized to my friends and let them know what I was going through
column7: and surprisingly
column8: one of my friends who I've known to have memory problems told me that he was taking the same medication. He ended up cutting his dose in half afterwards and noticed an improvement in memory. I still recommend it as a relief from the pit of anxiety and depression
column9: so you can understand how life should feel
column10: but I would never recommend it long term. Use the time on it to learn how to live."

1675$Condition: Depression$3/22/2015 4:50:23 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $3$3$5$Side effects for me were awful.  First months of taking it I had no appetite whatsoever and lost a lot of weight.  Yes, it helps with depression, but if you miss one or two doses, everything becomes awful.  Also, getting sleep with it is next to impossible. 
1676$Condition: Panic Disorder$2/26/2015 3:06:53 PM$Reviewer: Birdie, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$4$5$I have been on this medication for 8 years.  I spent the first 6 years on 40 mg, then cut it down to 20mg, and now am on just 10mg.  I needed it years ago because I was living in a very chaotic situation and was having panic attacks, crying jags at work, not being able to tolerate any stress, etc.  This medication has really helped me.  It takes about a month for the body to adjust to this medication.  I've tried Zoloft and Paxil, but they made me gain weight and I had alot of tiredness.  I also tried amitryptalene which was awful - I gained weight immediately.  Celexa has been nothing short of a miracle.  One of the side effects I experienced were some night sweats - though, they could be due to my bad periods.  The other side effect that never went away was a very low sex drive and a feeling of being non-emotional - not really ever crying or feeling ecstatically  happy - just the same all the time.  This was totally fine, but eventually, as my job and living situation got more secure, I didn't need as much of the dose.  That is why I have slowly decreased my dose to 10mg.  Though a small amount of anxiety has come back, so has the sex drive so that is good.  The celexa helps me to feel in great spirits, calm and collected under stress, and peaceful. It also helped with severe PMS which is a bonus.  Everyone's body is different, but for me, this has been a great drug.

column1: Please read do not go online looking up a ton of reviews it will scare you from taking it. If you do decide to read reviews make sure it's reviews from people that took it atleast 2 months because again the first month is hell for me anyway. column2: 30mg/day. It took a solid 6 weeks for it to kick in
column3: and a few months for the worst of the side effects to wear off (sweats
column4: vivid dreams
column5: disconnected feelings
column6: digestion issues). After that it just seemed to keep getting better. My everyday anxiety and occasional panic attacks became very muted
column7: and much easier to manage. This helped me stop depending on benzos for anxious ""flare ups."" Everyone around me noticed and my relationships improved. I lack the extremes in emotions
column8: for better or worse. In the beginning
column9: I wasn't noticing the weight gain. I actually felt like I was making better dietary choices. But I was a little more tired and I now require at least 8 hours of sleep a night or I need a nap during the day (less energy/activity). I also didn't notice the gradual decline in my sex drive. So
column10: now that I am at about a year of taking this RX
column11: I realize that while my anxiety and panic are managed--staving off the depression that they caused--the 20-25lbs I've steadily gained
column12: coupled with the low sex drive is negatively affecting me
column13: and my partner! So
column14: I'm looking to change meds at this point. Again. I've previously taken buspirone (Buspar)
column15: and paroxetine (Paxil). Neither were as effective as citalopram."

1795$Condition: Depression$10/17/2013 3:10:03 PM$Reviewer: IndigoIvy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I have suffered from treatment-resistant GAD for over 15 years and have tried every treatment in the book (except for Celexa). Nothing worked. Before Celexa I was on Lexapro, which is supposedly the newer, more 'refined' version of Celexa, and felt horrible. About 6 months ago, I decided to switch over to Celexa and have never felt better. I felt a difference right away (within a day or two). I am finally back to my happy, bubbly, chatty self. Other SSRIs that cut my anxiety made me feel 'flat'. Not Celexa. On Celexa I'm still able to feel my emotions-I can laugh and cry (when appropriate)-without feeling overwhelmed by them. I take it in the morning and have so much energy all day. I highly recommend this medication.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$3$I have tried everything.  Lexapro has 1  part to it and it comes from Celexa. I gained weight and didn't want to do anything.  Lethargic.  At first it worked great but quickly went to laying around all the time and not feeling motivated.  It's hard to get adjusted to and takes time.  Give yourself time and be patient. It did have some sexual sides effects but when my doctor put me on Wellbutrin it offset that side effect and I was back to having orgasms but I couldnt take the weight gain and tired feeling.  I am on Celexa now and its works GREAT for anxiety and I've lost the weight! But I am having some sexual side effects.  I think it also hinders my sleep a little bit.  I notice sometimes more anxiety but not giving up. This stuff works great for day to day living.  I will be patient and give it some more time.  For now this is working.

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$4$Started taking Celexa for anxiety/panic attacks.  Went from a healthy

column10: I WANTED to DIE.  After being off the medication for a few days
column11: I started feeling better. Now it has been a month and I have returned to being alive again. 8 hours of sleep and I am full of energy and excited to be active all day without getting tired and exhausted. Going to work now is refreshing compared to struggling on how to drive there safely without getting lost on the way.  I highly recommend the FDA reconsider the safety aspect of this drug. I wish my Dr. would take this medication for a month and report their mental/mood changes and desire to live.  If they did
column12: I believe they would reconsider prescribing this potentially life threatening drug. I will update this post after 6 months without Celexa
column13: but for now I recommend that this drug be banned for human consumption.

column3: couldn't stay awake during the day
column4: and finally started being awakened multiple times at night with panic attacks
column5: which was the end of my taking it. First day off had major headache

column7: but my family was convinced the antidepressant was working until they found out I hadn't taken it for a week. I am now hearing that the few days I was on it must have really helped me for over a week and am being pressured to go back on it or get a different one. Even if I hadn't had side effects
column8: I think the real problem in my case was (and is) that there are people in my life who are not willing to give me time to heal emotionally
column9: although they are very supportive of my need to heal physically. Perhaps the side effects even saved me from a worse problem of trying to get off it later. I think doctors are too quick to reach for the prescription pad

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $4$4$5$"I have been on 40 mg of Celexa 10 years for anxiety and panic attacks I developed as a teenager. I once tried to wean off of it with the help of my doctor when I was in college (I felt great and didn't think I needed it anymore) but the panic attacks returned so I've been consistently taking it and feel like a normal person! It originally took me about 2 weeks to fully adjust to the medication and help relieve my anxiety. Unlike what some people believe
column3: I still have emotions! I cry
column4: I get stressed
column5: I feel joy
column6: etc. I just feel like a normal person and that's all I could ask for. I did not gain weight either. The only side effect I have is occasionally I get ""brain farts"" which I like to call them when I have trouble remembering a fact or something! ha! (I've read this is a side effect of celexa) I can live with this because I feel like me and if you have had panic attacks you know how horrible they can be! My doctor says as long as I feel great I can take the drug as long as I want! :) Hope this helps anyone who is on the fence about celexa.  "

column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Caregiver) $2$1$5$"My wife has been on Celexa since 2004 and it helped with her depression till about 2008. She was started on 20 mgs then 40
column3: then 50
column4: then 60 and he wanted to take her to 80!  About 1 1/2 years ago I notice a change in her behavior.  My wife of 47 years was getting more distant and showed little or no affection.  Our relations are 0 now and we had always had a very affectionate and warm relationship
column5: and that was gone.  The day it came to a head I put my arms around her in the kitchen one morning to give her a hug and she stood there like she was a robot with no feeling.  It hit me so hard for the rest of that day I though I would die of a broken heart.  This is when I started to to use Web MD to look into the meds that she was taking and found our what was going on because of the Celexa.  I talked to her Psychiatrist and he told me in so may words it wasn't any of my business and my wife was his patient.  ""What the heck about our marriage""?  I trusted these doctors and I feel they have made a bigger mess of my wife then when she started her treatment for depression.  I am glad after we had talked the doctor has changed her to Lexapro with Wellbutrin and the fog seems to be lifting
column6: but she has a long way to go to get back to her normal self.  I feel that before our spouses are put on these medications the family members need to be brought in
column7: and helped to understand what they need to do to be the support structure for the depressed member.  If the member getting the help loses the love and support of the spouse it will make things much worse for the for the marriage an relationship. I would like to see the family member have several sections together and maybe work through the depression if possible before the SSRI medications are prescribed
column8: I feel that the patient becomes addicted to these medications.  I love my wife very much after all of these years and I wish I would have been included with the therapy that she was being prescribed and not pushed on the side."

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $3$3$4$This is only day 2 of taking this drug (20mg) but I wanted to share with the community how it is making me feel so that it may help others make an informed decision. I am a male
column4: weigh 195lbs
column5: with a very high metabolism. Diagnosed with GAD back in 2001 after a panic attack / excessive sweating (Hyperhidrosis) / general feeling that something bad was gonna happen (post 9/11?). Anxiety / Depression are in my family history. I have been taking .25mg of xanax as needed during this period of time with good results. After getting a new (and very stressful) job in May
column6: it didn't take long for my anxiety disorder to intensify and lead to a higher level of depression
column7: with the first ever suicidal thoughts coming over the holiday break. The stress of the ridiculous unrealistic expectations of my employer combined with the responsibility that if I mess up our soldiers lives are at risk was too much to bare. I began double dosing my xanax just to get thru the work day and drinking heavily after work almost daily. Mood swings were out of control and I would just cry. Decided to go on LOA and spoke with my PCP about my issues. She prescribed the Celexa and asked me to go back to taking the .25 xanax as needed instead of daily. I also began seeing a counselor who agreed with the PCP about trying Celexa. After my first dose yesterday I almost instantly felt some side effects. Nausea
column8: stomach pains (mild)
column9: light-headed
column10: excessive yawning
column11: dry and bad taste in my mouth
column12: shortness of breathe
column13: and sweating of hands / feet / underarms is on a new level. Also feel lethargic and like a zombie. I will post again in a few weeks once I have more experience with the drug.

column1:
2138$Condition: Depression$12/5/2011 5:17:31 PM$Reviewer: Stephanie, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$5$I was taking Lexapro for a few years before switching to Celexa due to insurance.  I had some unforseen circumstances that had me getting really depressed, unmotivated, and lack of energy, so my Dr. had increased my Lexapro from 10 mg to 20 mg.  When insurance became an issue I switched to Celexa 40mg.  When I had increased my Lexapro dose I found I was almost emotionless, and I found myself being forgetfull.  I also was experiencing a decrease interest in sex.  When I switched to Celexa those side effects disappeared.  I found myself being more motivated, feeling happy emotions again, and my sexual desire went almost back to normal.  I did notice when switching to Celexa that I experienced frequent yawning, but this went away after a month or so.  I have noticed that I have gained a bit of weight since I switched to Celexa, but I have not been on it long enough or gained enough weight to know for sure if Celexa is the reason.  I haven't had any change in my diet or activity level (I eat very healthy and i'm pretty active).  Overall I am very satisfied with this drug.  Although I was doing great using the lower dose of Lexapro, the Celexa worked much better for me when increasing the dose.  As with all anti depressants you have to wait 6-8 weeks to see the full effects and really know if it's working for you.

2172$Condition: Depression$10/12/2011 12:44:07 PM$Reviewer: Rick, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$After the death of my teensge son in 2003
i began using Lexapro due to a lot of anxiety and mild depression.  I fought through the earlier side-effects (jitteriness
column2: clenching my jaws
column3: some suicidal thoughts but not intense) and then began feeling better (more relaxed and not dwelling on particular negative thoughts).  After a couple of years
column4: I reduced dose from 10mg to 5mg.  After 3-4 years at 5mg

column1: I then weaned myself off over a six month period.  Within a few weeks
column2: I felt very irritable and a little out of control
column3: emotionally.  My wife sent me back to the doctor and was prescribed Celexa 20mg.  It helped immediately.  I've taken it for the past year without any noticable side-effects.  I'm 58 and very active.  I do go to the local YMCA about 5 days a week and run about 15 miles a week on the treadmill as well as using other exercise equipment.  I am a big advocate of using exercise to treat anxiety and depression.  Celexa and exercise has been a good combination for me.  I had always been fit and trim before my son died.  I gained about 15 pounds and had trouble being focused to lose weight.  During the past year I have lost 15 pounds and feel much
column4: much better.  I won't give Celexa all of the credit
column5: but I think it has helped.  I would recommend it for mild/moderate depression and anxiety."

column5: but my body composition is different.  I think after awhile your body gets used to the chemical and you are not so tired.  I have just recently started back at the gym
column6: so maybe I can get back in shape while on Celexa.

column3: caused more anxiety than it cured. Made me sleepy during the day and no sexual desire. Gave me tremors and weird brain freezes where I couldn't think straight. Never take it again.  I don't care what the doctors tell you.  These pills are poison
column4: they may relieve your sypmtoms for a while
column5: but when you try to get off them it's like a psychotic nightmare.  The doctors have no idea how horrible the withdrawal is from these medications.  Some people never return to normal after stopping.  Before taking any depression meds have your doctor give you several suggested ones to review before you select one. Try to find one that doesn't cause horrible withdrawal symptoms or have side effects worse than being depressed.  Good luck.

column2: with a beginning low dose. For several months

column4: starting with a low dosage. I developed a severe skin rash that has been diagnosed as an rare skin disorder.  The rash is still present on my back
column5: arms
column6: legs
column7: and in my hairline.  The itching is unbearable and predisone did not relieve it.  In reading these posts
column8: I read one from the woman whose sister committed suicide while on Celexa and that Celexa had become toxic because she had been dieting and her protein levels were low.  I believe that the Celexa became toxic in my system. Tell your doctor if you are dieting prior to taking this drug and be careful.  Celexa also made me like a zombie.

I no longer experienced mood swings and overall seemed happy about everything.  I have been off of it for 3 months due to the fact that it wasn't working anymore.  I started to become more irritable and mood swings were present once again and have since spoke to my doctor about switching me to something else....she prescribed Pristiq.  I am only one week in and feeling better so far.  As far as Celexa, if and when you want to ween yourself off, doing so cold turkey will not work.  You will have to cut the pill in half or in 4's and get off that way.  I tried cold turkey and experience the worst side effects ever.  Vivid nightmares, electrical brain shocks, severe headaches.  Its not worth it.  Go slowly when getting off this med and know that it may take you up to 8 months as it took 6 months to get off in my case.  Good luck!

19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I started taking Celexa 20mg (generic citalopram
column3: its a lot cheaper) The first week of August this year. I was diagnosed with Major Depression and Generalized Anxiety Disorder. I take it once a day at night (with food to diminish any possible gastrointestinal side effects). I am feeling 100% better than I did just a few months ago. I could not be more satisfied with the outcome. Before
column4: I could not sleep or focus on anything. I was nauseas and exhausted all of the time and I even felt so dizzy I couldnt drive or go to class. I am now falling asleep without the help of sleep-aids. I have energy again; I no longer sleep 8 hours and wake up feeling more exhausted than I did the night before. FOR ME this was the correct medication. NO MEDICATION IS CORRECT FOR EVERYONE. There are several negative reviews from individuals; take them with a grain of salt. Yes
column5: the first week can be miserable on a new anti-depressant (you have serotonin receptors all over your body
column6: including your brain
column7: blood vessels and stomach. While your body is adjusting to the new levels of serotonin
column8: you will probably feel nauseas and have a headache). You have to be patient though! After a week I could feel a difference
column9: and after a month I felt great. I feel like my old self again. The only downside I can find with the drug is that I cannot drink AT ALL on this drug. As with most SSRIs
column10: alcohol renders the medication ineffective because Alcohol occupies the same receptors in your body. Massive panic attacks came for an entire week after drinking moderately. I would happily give up alcohol for the rest of my life to NEVER feel the depression and anxiety ever again though. There are also sexual side effects
column11: but for me they have been positive. I can now maintain an erection and have a healthy sex life. I also have no problem with having orgasms. Do not rule out any drug because of the reviews on here. Eventually
column12: you WILL find the right drug for you :). HANG IN THERE!!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$I was having trouble with my mood swings related to my monthy hormones
column3: in addition my PMS symptoms would start 3 weeks before my period.  I asked my dr about my situation and she suggested this drug.  I was so skeptical because of the stigma attached to being on an anti-depressant.  It took me about 6 mos to decide then I couldn't take feeling the way I did anymore.  I can tell you that I am on 10 mg for about 9 mos and after the initial couple of weeks I don't have any side affects. I also feel like a normal person for the first time in a long time! Now I tell close friends about it who may have similar symptoms and I rave about it.  I used to cry for no reason and now I don't anymore but I still feel like myself.  I can honestly say that this has really had the most positive affect on my life.  I know everyone is different but it really has worked out so well for me!

column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$4$5$I have been on Gen. Celexa for about a year now. My first week I felt wasted drunk the entire time but it tapered of and since then I have felt great so long as I remember to take it. When I forget to take it the withdrawal symptoms are cripling; headaches
column3: out of body feelings
column4: tremmors
column5: etc. The constant negatives I have experienced are constant fatigue
column6: loss of appetite (lost 25 lbs in the last few months) sometimes I get irritated for no reason but not frequently. I really have not had a loss of sex drive which is unfortunate mine could stand to go down a bit. Overall Im very happy with it I feel more level and on the ball. I did try to take myself off of it at one point but was unsuccessful the side effects from quitting are unbarable severe nausea and dizziness crippling depression suicidal thoughts I could not summon the will to do anything I was physically and mentally destroyed they were enough to make me want to take it for the rest of my life. Do your research do not start this lightly it is a commitment and can really hurt you if you arent careful. The risks are worth the rewards if it works for you though.

column2: 45-54 on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$Celexa is great. I have been on it for about a year and continue to feel better. I had some side effects at firt but they went away. Give it time. Things often get much owrse before they get better when adjusting to a med.

column1: 2596$Condition: Repeated Episodes of Anxiety$8/8/2010 8:59:32 PM$Reviewer: mommacat4
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$3$5$"Started taking after being on Paxil 20mg for 1 1/2 months because the Paxil was not working.  The Celexa has brought me out of that paxil ""fog"" and not be tired all the time. The side effects were Very minimal because I had already went through them when starting the Paxil (and they weren't that bad anyways--)It has helped more then the Paxil did and has less side effects. I had dry mouth but drank lots of water and chewed gum-it only lasted about 4 days. Yawned alot for about a week but then  it was gone. Cloudy (Paxil) head was gone within 2 days and now I can really put things into perspective compared to before. I feel stronger emotionally and more in control of situations. I feel human again.Have ringing in my ears still(which Doc says is unrelated--BUT I disagree--it is dealable though if this pill is going to work then I can deal !! Have been on it for 3wks. I haven't been as depressed and so far my anxiety hasn't bothered me. If anything it has made me realize I needed the help and am glad and proud of myself for getting it and the will-power to get more help if needed. Will continue to update.It is important to know that most people do NOT have bad side effects to antidepressants..They can however talk themselves into it by being so nervous of a side effect..I tried to look at it differently..I kept looking for all the good the pill is doing and making me feel rather then any thing possibly bad
column3: which like I said was very minimum and dealable. Give it 1 1/2 wks. and see if it works for you (after all if you have the FLU you are sick that long also so take the pill and wait a week to decided. "

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$5$"I have been taking this med for 3-4 years now with doses right up to 60mg/day. I didn't find that 60mg was any more effective than 40mg so have stuck at 40 for most of the time I have been taking it.

column2: and as anxiety and panic were becoming more prominent in my depression we decided to try Celexa (citalopram). It has helped but only very slightly if I'm honest. I think for people who have mild-moderate depression it would probably be much more effective.

column2: but I can confidently say that I have had no bad side effects with Celexa
column3: and have found it one of the easiest SSRI's to tolerate in terms of side effects.

column1: Even though I have said I haven't noticed a massive difference from it

2626$Condition: Depression$7/16/2010 11:51:11 AM$Reviewer: beth, 35-44 Female  (Patient) $5$5$5$This medication has been the only drug that has ever even touched me for the better. I used to think Paxil worked because I didnt know how much better it could be with celexa but almost immediately I felt like a new and improved girl. I never had a major depressive episode just an underlying dysthymia(low level depression)since high school. I always thought that I was just unhappy and that was that. About 6 years ago I started taking celexa after lexapro made me have zero improvement. The rest is history. The most wonderful drug in the world. Did gain about 10 pounds but that was the beginning and I would rather be 10 pounds heavier and happier then 10 pounds thinner and miserable. Now Im the thinnest I've ever been. I came to the conclusion that when you start taking the celexa you relax and arent as crazy about being a half a pound more. I always thought the other drugs I took(paxil, prozac, zoloft, wellbutrin, lexapro, buspar were working because I used to talk myself into the fact that I felt better when I felt no change. Celexa changed my life and showed me that its ok to try different drug and treatment modalities until something works because this is your life. You are worth it. Being happy is something we all(or at least I)was willing to give-up because I thought something was wrong with me because I never had much of an effect from anything. Take care people and take the time to find something that will help you!

2646$Condition: Depression$7/3/2010 11:33:38 AM$Reviewer: Piece of Work, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$3 yrs ago in the midst of an event-induced depression & anxiety, 1st tried Zoloft; no help. Then citalopram (generic) at 20mg.  Almost immediate relief (but event soon concluded, too).  That said, the spiraling, out-of-control despair, dread & nausea stopped.  With citalopram, it felt like I was blocked from obsessing about the recent unendurable concerns (I'll get cancer like my mother, the world is full of incomprehensible suffering, even if things are good for a time they won't last, there's no joy...)-- either I couldn't focus on them anymore or I was on a track where I could not derail into despair.  At the same time, sexual interest declined and even when aroused, I couldn't climax.    BTW, husband has urged me NOT to go off drug.  He said he'd rather give up sex than have to go through my being depressed again!  Dr suggested reducing amount to 5 mg/day.  Sex now is usually better but still infrequent.  Realize menopause could be responsible, too, not to mention boring old routines of a 25 year marriage!  Weight gain-- a little.  Could be menopause, too.   Then again, if the effect of citalopram is to prevent focus on the negative, it stands to reason that it would prevent focus on the positive (sex, getting things accomplished).  There are always trade-offs.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $2$1$4$"After a year and a half I finally went off the citalopram. I would retreat outside to have a drink(alcohol) and a smoke and then come in feeling more able to deal.  I went from a drink during the weekend to everyday.  I'am so glad to be off it although I did it by going cold-turkey and it's made me feel a little lightheaded and I was a bit weepy at first.  I used Prozac 20 years ago for 2 years and that worked fine.  This citalopram makes me feel like I lost about a year of my life.  I did'nt feel present in my life as a wife and mother of 3. I'm just really puzzled and without health insurance a sit down with a doctor is not a possibility.  Hope this helps.

2960$Condition: Depression$10/5/2009 6:18:44 AM$Reviewer: caz, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $3$1$5$Took cipramil (celexa brand name in the UK) for 2 years. A littel advertised side effect is ""disinhibition"". This caused me to make inappropriate comments and swear more etc...very weird! Unfortunately I lost my job over it before I discovered the cause and stopped taking the drug. When I stopped I found I was not depressed as badly as when I was on it and the anxiety had gone as well... this drug can be useful for short term use prior to counselling to deal with rather than bury the issues. I was also suffering from what is quaintly called ""suicidal ideation"" as I was convinced my family would be better off without me...really bad shit I think you'll agree! The reason for the disinhibition is that serotonin (which this drug increases in the brain to make you happier allegedly) is involved in your internal behaviour regulation. Really look out for this and the suicidal thoughts if you are taking this stuff esp long term.. at least it didn'tmake me sweat as much as Prozac did! good luck out there everyone."

3074$Condition: Repeated Episodes of Anxiety$7/11/2009 2:28:52 AM$Reviewer: zombiekristen, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$3$3$I took Celexa for about 6 months for extreme anxiety with depression and some suicidal thoughts. For 4 of those months I continued to self-medicate with marijuana on and off (hoping that the meds would be enough to help me quit, after two weeks, I no longer was able to hold out). I took 20mg for one week and then upped to 40mg ever since. In the beginning it made me dizzy and very tired. The drowsiness never subsided which is why I switched to taking it at night and have been ever since. When I had finally been able to stop smoking marijuana 4 months later, my anxiety had subsided and my depression blew up big time. I had many crying spells. I could not concentrate. I was very lethargic, as I had been the entire time, and the celexa was not helping that. What I needed was energy. I stopped taking the pill today with instructions from my doctor to switch immediately to 150mg of Effexor (which I'm pretty nervous about...) and the withdrawal effects I had were: vertigo, sweating, crying, severe depression. Celexa works for many people. It helped me out in the beginning, as it was the first time I had ever been on an antidepressant. But it never was consistent for me, and in the end my depression became unacceptable and the Celexa was doing nothing to help.

column2: I really like the way Celexa helps me manage life; way better than before. I also benefit from the return of my sex drive; which was almost totally gone while using paxil. 3096$Condition: Panic Disorder$6/20/2009 3:22:38 PM$Reviewer: WorldTraveler, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$Over the past few years I developed a fear of falling, the phobia increased so that I was holding on to walls within our home, unable to walk to my car, even with 2 canes, petrified in parking lots, even with a shopping card.  A psychiatrist put me on 5 mg. 2x a day, but the AM dose left me too groggy, the 5 mg. PM dose gave me the kind of sleep I haven't had since I was a teenager (deep, wonderful dream-filled sleep).  After 3 weeks, my anxiety began to lesson, after 6 weeks I was walking around not holding onto walls.  It has changed me life.  I'm calmer & the little stuff doesn't bother me any more.  The 10 lb. I gained after breaking my back, I can't seem to lose, so weight loss is harder, my strong libido is nearly non-existent, but I don't care, I'm not filled with dread & anxiety.  I'm not worried all the time.  Close friends have noticed these changes.  After 9 months, I have no plans to discontinue it.  Some of the night sweats others are feeling are probably peri-menopause.  It is hard on the stomach, I took it with 2 75 mg. Zantac for the first 2 weeks, then 1 Zantac for another 2 weeks, now my stomach is used to it.  I take it before bedtime.  So the nausea others have experienced might be alleviated by taking it with a Zantac because Celexa is an acidic drug.  5 mg. works so well for me, I'm incredulous as to the high doses that others are on.  It does take 6 weeks for the full effect, so be paient.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $3$1$3$"I decided to start taking Celexa after my samples of Lexapro ran out (my insurance didn't cover it). While on celexa I felt numb and very much unlike myself. I was on anti-anxiety meds for one year and decided to go off them due my complete lack of interest in sex and didn't want to deal with what I was experiencing for the rest of my life. I kept thinking there has to be a better way and I tapered off over a 4 week period. Getting off celexa was one of the worst exp. of my life. I had headaches
column3: brain zaps
column4: I was sick to my stomach
column5: nauseous all the time and had horrible mood swings for two full months. About three months after I stopped I had a horrible emotional break down. I was at my wits end and hit the internet to research natural ways to calm me down. After trying 5-htp (which helped a little) my boyfriend mentioned magnesium deficiency. I did a little research on the symptoms and found that all my symptoms pointed towards this. Muscle tension
column6: anxiety and horrible obsessive thoughts
column7: insomnia
column8: etc. After I did a little research on which brand of mag. to buy
column9: I decided on ""Slow Mag"". I took 4 tabs a day
column10: two in the morning on an empty stomach and two in the evening on an empty stomach. I felt more relaxed and calm within a few hours of taking my first dose; my muscle tension seemed to just melt away. I've been taking slow mag everyday for a few weeks now and I have not felt this good in years! All symtomps I mentioned above are GONE!!! I urge everyone to please
column11: please try mag first before giving in to the drugs our doctors push on us. Magnesium test are rarely able to detect a deficiency
column12: so just give it a try and DO YOUR OWN RESEARCH! There is a large majority of people with this deficiency and don't know it. If you decide to give mag a try
column13: please research brands and make sure you buy a quality supplement that includes calcium. I want to help as many people as I can
column14: you don’t have to be a zombie! Good Luck!"

25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$2$3$"After taking Celexa for just a couple of weeks
column3: my wife and I both noticed a change in my behavior for the better.  I was less stressed
column4: didn't contemplate negative thoughts as often
column5: and was overall a more ""happy"" person.  I quote happy because it has always been my belief that depression is cause by actual occurrences in life
column6: and the only way to truly cure yourself of depressive thoughts is to face the things that are difficult to face and ""take care of them"" thoroughly.  I feel that the drug simply makes things ""easier to deal with"" than it actually makes you happy or less depressed.  However
column7: after nearly 3 months of drug therapy
column8: I crashed very hard.  No suicidal thoughts
column9: but I was ready to quit my job and divorce my wife even though we have three small children.  This episode didn't last even 24 hours
column10: but it was one of the worst I had experience in my life.  This drug also made me extremely tired.  I simply could not get enough sleep almost as if I were a teenager once again.  After my ""crash""
column11: I went off of the drug completely cold turkey.  During the first week being off of the drug
column12: I felt almost drunk or high with a fuzzy state of mental being and a constant woozy feeling in my head.  During the second week
column13: I suffered what I will call ""brain zaps""
column14: nothing painful but once every 1-2 minutes I would get a quick ""unbalanced"" feeling in my head that would last no more than a second.  It is now early in my third week of being off of the drug
column15: and the brain zaps are waning
column16: but my feeling of lack of good sleep is still very persistent."

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $3$1$5$"I've had (undiagnosed) chronic depression as an ongoing background for years. Then last year I landed in a terrible work environment and chose to leave it
column3: in a way that ended rather traumatically. I went to consulting and the shrink freaked out saying I am so depressed I must go on meds now. I was hardly sleeping every night.

column1: I went to my M.D. who was also enthusiastic about the treatment. ""You will still be yourself""
column2: he said. He chose Celexa and put me on a very low dose (10 mg).
I bought a month's worth and took it... for six days. Yes
column3: the pain and self-immolation inside my mind were numbed. BUT The last thing I can say is that I was myself. I was definitely NOT.

column2: off and running as soon as the alarm goes and sometimes a bit before that on most days; suddenly I would roll around in bed unable to switch my mind on for an hour.

column1: - My sexual appetite is quite healthy and wide-ranging. Overnight it was simply gone. I had never felt anything like it.
- Perhaps worst of all: I am a researcher. I use my brain for a living. I write research articles. But suddenly
column2: by brain became a fuzzball. I could not think for one minute straight. Not because I had other stuff on my mind; because it became a fuzzball.

column1: This thing seems to work for other people
column2: maybe they are less sensitive to drugs in general. I know I am
column3: and with all the pain
column4: anger and depression I prefer to be myself than the numb slob I became when on this thing.

column1: The good thing about stopping after such a short while is that the ""chill-off"" period was much shorter. Yet
column2: 3 days after getting off Celexa I had a day of worse depression than I had ever felt. But that was it.

column1: Since then I exercise on a daily basis
column2: put a lot of effort into my research
column3: and try to move my life back on track. It will never be easy - but believing that ""you can take a pill and it will be better"" is in my view no different than becoming a drug addict."

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$4$"I tried to quit smoking and had another experience with panic & anxiety attacks.  Went to my family dr. who put me on Celexa.  Have had prozac in past with no side effects. Questioned why Celexa
column3: was told this is better for anxiety. Was on Celexa for 12 days and everyday I became increasingly sicker. Told my doctor and was told these were side effects. Went to a different doc & therapist and both told me I had Serotonin syndrome.(can be fatal)  BE CAREFUL of this drug. My Symptoms were: Increased anxiety
column4: hot flash that started at my lower abdomin and went up to my chin
column5: rapid heart rate
column6: high blood pressure(never had high blood pressure b/4)
column7: severe nausea
column8: loss of appetite(couldn't even look at food.(lost 12 lbs in 2 weeks) muscle spasms
column9: couldn't sleep and when tried to sleep the slightest noise made me jump out of my skin. Low grade fever 99.7
column10: massive headache. By day 12 extreme dizziness and couldn't stand up due to weakness and balance loss. It took my body 8 days after stopping Celexa to return to almost normal. After this experience I will try to make it through anxiety without any meds.

column1: *Please Note I have learned a lesson from this experience if you have been diagnoised with anxiety or panic disorder I feel we are labeled by some of the  medical profession.  So any complaints or symptoms you experience might not be taken as serious as someone who has not been diagnoised with these disorders.    Please if you feel something isn't right with what's going on in your body listen to yourself and get a second opinion. "

column4: my doctor put me on Celexa (Lexapro's cousin) and I have never looked back.  I do not ""hide out"" or avoid social situations as much as I used to.  I laugh and love to make people laugh.  People that I confide in about taking an antidepresant can not believe that I actually NEED this.  That is how much this has helped me.  Lastly
column5: the only side effect I get is if I forget to take it for a few days I will cry at the drop of a hat.  I will feel like crying over ANYTHING when I skip a dose/doses.  It is then I know I am off my routine... but no other side effects.  Hope this helps someone else."

column1: 3524$Condition: Depression$7/3/2008 12:45:43 AM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$2$4$"I was taking this medication for 6-7 years for depression.  Instantly
column2: major weight gain occurred and would not come off.  Tired all the time; over time had to increase dosage and then decrease when I got too anxious.  If forgot to take it for a day
column3: sickness (stomach upset
column4: nervousness) would occur.  When I finally decided I did not need it anymore (with my doctor's knowledge); I gradually decreased the dosage.  BE AWARE: There is no going ""cold turkey"" with this medicine; you will become very physically sick if you do.  I gradually cut back 5-10 mg about every three-five months as I could; then at the lowest dose
column5: went every other day until the medication was finished.  The highest I was at was 60 mg.  It took about 2 years to get off the medication.  It was very tough; there was stomach upset; worry; diarhea; cold sweats; felt like my head was ""foggy"".  But it can be done.  If you feel you need to get off this medicine; talk to your doctor and give yourself A LOT of time (gradually; at least a year).  I really think your body and mind become dependent on it.  If I could do it
column6: anyone can.  Best of Luck; be blessed."

My dr increased my dosage twice. I feel much better. I don't cry at the drop of a hat for no particular reason anymore. My thoughts seem more clear and not jumbled.
